locus
  • Reference

Gather settings for parallel inference on partitioned predictor space.

Parallel applications of the method on blocks of candidate predictors for large datasets allows faster and less RAM-greedy executions.

set_blocks(p, pos_bl, n_cpus, verbose = TRUE)

Arguments

p

Number of candidate predictors.
pos_bl

Vector gathering the predictor block positions (first index of each block).
n_cpus

Number of CPUs to be used. If large, one should ensure that enough RAM will be available for parallel execution. Set to 1 for serial execution.
verbose

If TRUE, messages are displayed when calling set_blocks.

Value

An object of class "blocks" preparing the settings for parallel inference in a form that can be passed to the locus function.

See also

locus

Examples

user_seed <- 123; set.seed(user_seed)
n <- 200; p <- 1200; p0 <- 200; d <- 50; d0 <- 40
list_X <- generate_snps(n = n, p = p)
list_Y <- generate_phenos(n = n, d = d, var_err = 0.25)

dat <- generate_dependence(list_snps = list_X, list_phenos = list_Y,
                           ind_d0 = sample(1:d, d0),
                           ind_p0 = sample(1:p, p0), vec_prob_sh = 0.05,
                           max_tot_pve = 0.9)
n_bl <- 6
pos_bl <- seq(1, p, by = ceiling(p/n_bl))
list_blocks <- set_blocks(p, pos_bl, n_cpus = 2)
#> locus applied in parallel on 6 blocks of candidate predictors, using 2 CPUs.
#> Please make sure that enough RAM is available. 

vb <- locus(Y = dat$phenos, X = dat$snps, p0_av = p0, link = "identity",
            list_blocks = list_blocks, user_seed = user_seed)
#> == Preparing the data ... 
#> ... done. == 
#> 
#> Provided p0_av = 200 interpreted as the prior number of predictors associated with at least one response. 
#> 
#> == Preparing the hyperparameters ... 
#> 
#> list_hyper set automatically. 
#> ... done. == 
#> 
#> == Preparing the parameter initialization ... 
#> 
#> Seed set to user_seed 123. 
#> list_init set automatically. 
#> ... done. == 
#> 
#> ============================================================== 
#> == Variational inference for sparse multivariate regression == 
#> ============================================================== 
#> 
#> ... done. == 
#>
